record.name: STD
record.description:
Each individual style description is stored in an STD structure.

Class and fields descriptions are quoted from Microsoft Office Word 97-2007 Binary File Format and [MS-DOC] - v20110608 Word (.doc) Binary File Format
record.author: Sergey Vladimirov; according to Microsoft Office Word 97-2007 Binary File Format Specification [*.doc] and [MS-DOC] - v20110608 Word (.doc) Binary File Format

bit.name: sti
bit.description: An unsigned integer that specifies the invariant style identifier for application-defined styles, or 0x0FFE for user-defined styles

bit.name: fScratch
bit.description: spare field for any temporary use, always reset back to zero!

bit.name: fInvalHeight
bit.description: Specifies whether the paragraph height information in the fcPlcfPhe field of FibRgFcLcb97, for any paragraphs having this paragraph style, MUST be ignored. SHOULD be 0

bit.name: fHasUpe
bit.description: This bit is undefined and MUST be ignored

bit.name: fMassCopy
bit.description: This bit is undefined and MUST be ignored

bit.name: stk
bit.description: style kind

bit.name: istdBase
bit.description: base style

bit.name: cupx
bit.description: number of UPXs (and UPEs)

bit.name: istdNext
bit.description: next style

field.name: bchUpe
field.description: An unsigned integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of std in LPStd. This value MUST be equal to cbStd in LPStd

field.name: grfstd
field.description: A GRFSTD that specifies miscellaneous style properties

bit.name: fAutoRedef
bit.description: number of UPXs (and UPEs)

bit.name: fHidden
bit.description: Specifies whether this style is not shown in the application UI

bit.name: f97LidsSet
bit.description: Specifies whether sprmCRgLid0_80 and sprmCRgLid1_80 were applied, as appropriate, to this paragraph or character style for compatibility with applications that do not support sprmCRgLid0, sprmCRgLid1, and sprmCFNoProof

bit.name: fCopyLang
bit.description: If f97LidsSet is 1, this value specifies whether the applied compatibility sprmCRgLid0_80 or sprmCRgLid1_80 specified an actual language or a special LID value (0x0400) signifying that no proofing is needed for the text. This MUST be ignored if f97LidsSet is 0

bit.name: fPersonalCompose
bit.description: Specifies whether this character style can be used to automatically format the new message text in a new e-mail

bit.name: fPersonalReply
bit.description: Specifies whether this character style can be used to automatically format the new message text when replying to an e-mail

bit.name: fPersonal
bit.description: Specifies whether this character style was applied to format all message text from one or more users in an e-mail

bit.name: fNoHtmlExport
bit.description: This value MUST be 0 and MUST be ignored

bit.name: fSemiHidden
bit.description: Specifies whether this style is not shown in the simplified main styles UI of the application

bit.name: fLocked
bit.description: Specifies whether this style is prevented from being applied by using the application UI

bit.name: fInternalUse
bit.description: This bit is undefined and MUST be ignored

bit.name: fUnhideWhenUsed
bit.description: Specifies whether the fSemiHidden property is to be set to 0 when this style is used

bit.name: fQFormat
bit.description: Specifies whether this style is shown in the Ribbon Style gallery

bit.name: fReserved
bit.description: This value MUST be 0 and MUST be ignored
